resources.string:
An implementation of the COPUS protocoal by Smith, Jones, Gilbert, and Wieman. More details can be found at http://www.cwsei.ubc.ca/resources/COPUS.htm 


Written by Kelly Black, Department of Mathematics, University of Georgia.
This will delete the current observation. Do you want to continue?

The results of this observation have not been saved. You need to click on the mail button to send the results so that they can be shared. You can email them to your self so that you can retrieve them on another computer.\n\nThe next time you run the timer these results will be deleted.

The options and layout are to aid in implementing an observation based on the COPUS protocol. The basic idea is that you start the timer, record the observations, and stop the timer. Before starting the timer again you have to send the last observation using email so that the observations can be saved.


How to operate:


  1. Click the start button to begin the timer.
  2. While the timer is on touch the checkboxes coresponding to the activities you observe.
  3. Every two minutes the checkboxes are saved, cleared, and the cycle starts over.
  4. At the end of the class period touch the stop button.
  5. Touch the email icon at the bottom of the screen, and the results will be attached to an email.
  6. Send the results to yourself or someone else, and they can be downloaded onto another computer and analyzed.

More information about the protocol is available at http://www.cwsei.ubc.ca/resources/COPUS.htm.
